item.title: The Mandalorian Adventures - Clan of Two Expansion Preview
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/tabletop/previews/mandalorian-adventures-clan-of-two-expansion-preview

When we first reviewed The Mandalorian Adventures here on TechRaptor, we were truly impressed by the depth of the game and replay value contained within the core box. But every adventure, no matter how great, deserves a second season (or more)! Which is why we're thrilled to preview The Mandalorian Adventures - Clan of Two, which the fine folks at Unexpected Games (via distributor Asmodee USA) sent along a copy of for us to check out!

The Mandalorian Adventures - Clan of Two is an expansion to The Mandalorian Adventures, inspired by events taking place in the second season of The Mandalorian. With new heroes to play as and new missions to tackle, this great expands the base game - but, be warned, you need the base game to be able to play The Mandalorian Adventures - Clan of Two.

Box Contents Include:

  • 1 Rulebook
  • 1 Mission Book
  • 95 Cards (Including 4 New Heroes)
  • 18 Mini Cards
  • 137 Tokens
  • 4 Standees
  • 2 Mercenary Mission Sheets (Double-Sided)

What New Heroes Are Included In The Mandalorian Adventures - Clan of Two?

There are four new heroes included in The Mandalorian Adventures - Clan of Two that you can play as with both these expansion missions and the missions included in the core game. These include: the exiled Jedi Ahsoka Tano, famed bounty hunter Boba Fett, Mandalorian heiress Bo-Katan Kryze, and master assassin and sharpshooter Fennec Shand.

Each of these characters also have new persistent character abilities, changing how they play and making them feel wholly unique compared to the characters contained in the core box. Let's take a look hero by hero and chat briefly about their abilities!

Ahsoka Tano

Ahsoka Tano's hero card may seem like it comes with a major drawback - she can only attack enemies within the same space as her? But along with it perfectly fitting her flavor (she is, after all, a lightsaber wielder), but with her "Shoto Lightsaber" card shown above (of which she has two in her deck), she could potentially dish out 6 damage!

Boba Fett

Everyone's favorite bounty hunter Boba Fett blasts onto the scene with the persistent character ability you see above, allowing him to attack twice in a turn (as long as there aren't too many other cards in the action slot). Another great ability that gives you a huge benefit while also making you think carefully about how you play!

Bo-Katan

Bo-Katan is the most unique of any hero we've seen come to the game, as her persistent character ability says that she has to keep the top card of her skill deck faceup! This is a very fun mechanic, leading to a lot of shenanigans with trying to manipulate your skill deck to get the most out of her every turn, while giving you a bit of extra info you wouldn't normally know.

Fennec Shand

Fennec Shand is an unparalleled sniper in the Star Wars universe, and her ability to increase the range of her attack by one (at the cost of one strength) will make her close some pretty incredible distances in the game. Remember, three spaces can often feel like half the board when you're winding around the map!

What Are The New Missions Like In The Mandalorian Adventures - Clan of Two?

The new missions in The Mandalorian Adventures - Clan of Two break the mold from the original game in fun and challenging ways, while providing a diverse set of challenges and maps that require different plans of attack! I don't want to spoil too much (that's part of the fun of playing The Mandalorian Adventures), so I'll stick with showing off and describing a bit about the first of the four missions in this expansion, which recreates the thrilling fight against the warlord Morgan Elsbeth on Calodan.

This first mission really feels like a race against time, as each time you trigger the 6+ space you'll be advancing the power track - this increases the hit points on Morgan Elsbeth, who you'll need to flush out after saving three different prisoners. It's a tough one, right out the gate, and introduces enemies with new abilities.

Along with the four core missions, there are also two new mercenary missions included in this expansion - and it all goes together to form what seems to me to be an extremely strong expansion. It's more of what we loved about The Mandalorian Adventures, but the abilities on these four new heroes feel extremely different!

With an MSRP at $39.99, this feels like a perfect addition if you've played through and explored all that the original Mandalorian Adventures had to offer. Hitting shelves everywhere Friday, June 6th!

The copy of The Mandalorian Adventures - Clan of Two used in the creation of this preview was provided to TechRaptor by Asmodee USA.

Giaco Furino joined the TechRaptor team as a Staff Writer in 2019 after searching for a dedicated place to write and talk about Tabletop Games. In 2020, he… More about Giaco

item.title: Disney Lorcana Fabled Preview Features Elsa Gift Box
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/tabletop/news/disney-lorcana-fabled-preview-features-elsa-gift-box

Ravensburger has released new information on the upcoming Disney Lorcana Fabled set. The latest set of the trading card game based on iconic Disney characters will be getting a new format, new products, and a gift box featuring the ice queen, Elsa.

As part of their Weekly Lorecast on their official Twitch channel, Ravensburger showcased their Disney Lorcana Fabled preview. The preview centered on official products and accessories alongside the full Fabled lineup of booster packs, Illumineer's Troves, and starter decks.

For those who want to get into Disney Lorcana, the two starter decks are a decent entry point.The first is an Emerald and Ruby deck sporting Max, Goofy, and Powerline from A Goofy Movie. The other deck, showcasing Ariel and Mulan, is an Amber and Sapphire deck. Both will be sold at an MSRP of $16.99 each.

The new products and accessories will portray other characters featured in the set. Those accessories are a pair of Goofy Movie and Mulan-themed card sleeve packs and deck cases. The card sleeves will be sold at an MSRP of $9.99, and the deck boxes will be sold at an MSRP of $5.99.

In addition, two playmats will be available. One spotlights Cinderella as she gets her gorgeous dress from her fairy godmother. The other showcases Mufasa, King of Pride Rock. Both playmats will be available at an MSRP of $19.99

For Frozen fans, the Disney Lorcana Fabled preview contains a new gift box. The box will contain five booster packs, an Elsa-themed storage box, three punch-out dividers, and a glimmer foil promo card of Elsa - The Fifth Spirit. This Elsa Gift Box will be available this October at an MSRP of $29.99.

Lastly, the Disney Lorcana Fabled preview has confirmed the launch of two new formats. The first, Super Sealed, is a variation on a sealed draft. You get four boosters from each of the most recent sets. From there, you must make a three-ink color deck of 50 cards in under 60 minutes.

You are allowed to change cards between matches, but must revert back to the initial deck after each round and before the start of a new match.

The second format is called Triple Deck Constructed Format (Single Elimination). As the name implies, players create three decks, each covering all six ink colors. Players then play best-of-three against one another. You can even use an ink token to "bench" one of your opponents decks. The Grand Finals are determined in a best-of-five.

Disney Lorcana Fabled will have a pre-release on August 29. The set's full release will be September 5.

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. This… More about Tyler
